result.execSummary:
The defendant Taylor Ann Kratochwill-Loomis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. No possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages. Submit DNA sample. Any bond on hand will be applied towards costs.
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

filed by Atty Allison Borsheim

11:37 AM Cases called: 22CF337, 21CM143, 22CM71, 22CM146, & 22CM191. Prosecuting attorney Jonathan Ross in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Taylor Ann Kratochwill Loomis in court, in custody.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim in court for Taylor Ann Kratochwill Loomis. Agreement recited by State. In 22CF337 Right to preliminary hearing recited to defendant. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 1 of 22CF337 and to counts 1 & 2 of 22CM146. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. All remaining counts and cases dismissed and read in. Sentencing statements. In both cases, court withheld sentence, placed the defendant on probation for 24 months. Conditions of probation in each include: Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. No possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages. Submit DNA sample. Costs of $518.00 in 22CF337 and possibility of expungement upon successful completion of probation. Cost in 21CM146 count 1 $443.00 and count 2 $243.00.  Any cash bond on hand will be applied towards costs. Jail credit to be determined. 12:07 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
